intro: Zappania citrodora, commonly known as the lemon tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Rutaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its fragrant, citrus-scented leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are rich in vitamin C and commonly used in culinary and medicinal applications. Zappania citrodora thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, requiring well-drained soil and full sunlight. Its botanical features make it an important ornamental and agricultural plant in many regions.
